appliance recycling is up to the homeowner.  yard waste, propane tanks, electronics are taken at compost site alternate Saturdays April-Nov, 16/year  residents have access to 12-13 HHW collection per year through SSRC reciprocity HHW collections
Adams is a member of the Northern Berkshire Solid Waste Management District.
C&D includes bulky and scrap metal.
Drop -off yard waste only available to households with permit for transfer station  Trash collection not all municpal buildings only 5 or 6

Oil based paint is collected at the Lexington Hazardous waste facility 8 x year.  Water based paint is collected curbside on a 52 week basis.  Books, textiles, scrape metal, clothing, aluminum cans and electronics are collected 2X at the DPW yard drop off collection.
Ashby Recycle Center & Transfer Station is open the 2nd & 4th Saturday of the month from 9 am to 1 pm.  Used oil and antifreeze is collected at the Fire Station Sunday mornings.
Ashfield is part of the Hilltown Resource Management Cooperative
A portion of funding for a one-time household hazardous waste day was provided by hauling contractor as required in trash/recycling contract.

Single stream recycling commenced July 2010. Data prior to July 2010 is unavailable.  The reported tonnage is based upon a full year's projected average using the single stream data from July 2010 through Decenber 2010.    The Town is entering into a regional House Hold Hazardous Waste colleciton program in Devens.  This faciltiy should be fully operational Spring 2011.
C&D and Bulky are combined.
Other Recyclables represents our electronics collection.
Other materials - Yard Waste tonnage
Latex paint, if dried can go in the trash (year round) Oil base paint is collected at the annual Household Hazardous  Waste drop off, open to Billerica residents

We are scheduled to sponsor a regional hazardous waste day in the Fall of 2011.  Blackstone picks up curbside recycling and bales all product for resale for our residential, commercial and school districts.

The Bolton is a hoping to become a member community of the Devens Regional Household Hazardous Products Collection Program.  This is expected to begin this spring and will offer our residents 20 hazardous product collection days per year.
The 12 hazardous waste collections is the paint sites that are open saturdays May-Aug.  the food waste is Haymarket.
#5 Yard Waste Collection: drop off is in neighboring Topsfield through mutual agreement between towns.

Several items in #3 are blank as the material is included in comingled/mixed categories.  Other materials in #3 includes ash, propane tanks, and electronics/computers.  We also diverted 1122 T of Compostables/Organics.

Paint Swap Open & Paint collected daily 4/1 thru 10/31 - 6 days per week. Hazardous (pool chemicals, poisons, fertilizers)  are stored in locked container at recycle center for HHW Week if they cannot be reused.
We have one hazardous waste production collection with a neighboring town yearly. We are now recycling single stream and it seems to be working very well.

1998 tons of yard waste + Xmas trees, 154 tons electronics, 63 tons food scraps from residential drop-off and a few participating schools.  Small businesses do use our Recycling Drop-off Center, which is included in the total tons for cardboard, mixed paper, commingles, plastics and scrap metal.

We began a school composting program in the spring of 2010 which has reduced our solid waste tonnage from the school site by approximately 30%. While steel/tin and aluminum are collected in separate bins, the town reports on a combined total weight of these materials.    We began collecting Styrofoam in January 2011 as a one time event and instituted 52 Styrofoam drop-off May 2011.

Charlton has no municipal trash or recycling service.  Everything is done by private subscription.  Only five of our seven licensed haulers reported their 2010 residential rates.  The households served total is only about half the town, the remainder being either with the two other haulers or not engaging in trash service.  Some of the haulers provide single stream, others separate.  I do not have breakdowns from all the haulers so report total tonnage under single stream as the bulk of the tonnage reported is from the two haulers using single stream.   As for HHWD, Casella provides 4 to the town in conjunction with the Southbridge HHWD as the landfill borders Charlton and sits partially on former Charlton land.  I'm not sure you would classify our HHWD as a regional or reciprocal event. There is no cost to the Town although we provide two volunteers.

P. 1, #5: 2 yard waste events/year for brush only - currently no town leaf programs.  P. 2, #3: Single stream weights are for July-Dec. 2010; Dual stream numbers are for the beginning of the year.  Mixed paper includes 84 tons from Abitibi boxes at Chelmsford public schools.  Scrap metal/white goods tons are those collected through the town's fee-based curbside program with Appliance Recyclers.  Textile tonnage is that collected from Planet Aid and N.E. Clothes Recyclers boxes in town.  "Other materials" - tons of electronics collected through Appliance Recyclers' curbside program.  P. 2, #4-6: Chelmsford holds one HHW collection/year and also pays for residents to attend the Minuteman facility in Lexington.
Trash tonnage = 523 tons MSW compactor and 232 bulky waste box.  Cheshire is a member of the Northern Berkshire Solid Waste Management District.

Devens municipal recycling drop off collection includes the 60 businesses in addition to the 110 households and is available 24 hours. However, some businesses have their own private recycling pick up. There is no municipal trash service for residents and businesses.
Douglas residents can take oil, oil filters, antifreeze, CFLS, thormostates, oil based paint, flow meters, mercury products to the Blackstone Valley Regional Recycling Center in Northbridge, MA

Since we are an Island, we offered a 2 week window to collect Haz Waste from the home owners, this was collected, shipped to the mainland and disposed of through clean harbors. We currently Recycle very well, but need more effort on C+D material. This we are being charged for as we do not have the dumpster space to really seperate effectively.

Lanesborough has municipal recycling only.  We are a member of the Northern Berkshire Solid Waste Management District.

WE COLLECT PAINT JUNE, JULY, AUGUST AND SEPTEMBER EVERY YEAR.  SINCE THE MAJORITY OF HAZ MAT IS PAINT, USED MOTOR OIL, BATTERIES, ETC. AS MENTIONED ABOVE, WE ONLY DO FULL HAZ MAT EVERY 2 YEARS WHICH IS ALL THAT IS NEEDED.

Regional Waste Water Plant open 12 times for Medical Sharps, used waste oil, mercury products & batteries drop-off.  Local Hardware Stores collect florescent bulbs.  City Hall, DPW & Health Dept have Hg drop off daily.  Health Dept has un-used/Expired Meds drop-off quarterly.  Spring & Fall HHW drop-off events include propane tanks, CRTs & tires  MSW contractor collects propane tanks, CRTs & tires by Appt
The town collects trash and recycle material from all units up to a four family unit.

The Lunenburg did not have a local HHW collection as the town has been working in collaboration with the Devens Regional Household Hazardous Products Collection Program which will be accomplised in 2011. As such, we participated in the "open" regional HHW collection events.

Restructured data collection to give better tracking of numbers and diversion savings.  HHW Day is conducted jointly with the Swampscott.  Yardwaste is collected curbside 4 weeks in the fall and 2 weeks in the spring as well as drop-off.

We collect metals during yard waste collection days - every Saturday May - Novemeber.    Household Hazardous Waste is yearly with Newburyport.

Recycling material is collected bi-52 at curbside with no charge to residents.  Residents can also bring recycles to transfer station operated by Waste Management at the Middleboro landfill.  Residents can pay for Town curbside trash collection or contract with private haulers.  Housing with greater than three units and businesses must have private haulers.
Middlefield is part of the Hilltown Resource Management Cooperative
Milton only collects curbside trash and recycling from certain small businesses, not all businesses as a whole

Town hires outside contractor for curbside recycling pick-up.  Rely on Springfield MRF to provide data for Montgomery.  Only have January - June, 2010 tonnage information which is not broken down into the various categories except paper and containers.  6 Mos. total tonnage was 43.43.

New Bedford has a surplus paint shed that accepts both usable latex and oil-based paint April through October.
We hold a 12 drop off for all materials as listed above.  Once a year Newburyport hosts an event with 2 other towns, that is totally comprehensive but also has Clean Harbors on site.

Reusable latex is only accepted M-F from May-Oct at the Recycling Depot for swapping/reuse.  Otherwise, residents are instructed to dry out and place in trash carts.    All households can go to Recycling Depot.    Other recyclables include: CRTs, electronics, FBs, batteries, Mercury items, waste oil, and antifreeze    Yard Waste collection is 39 weeks =  37 weeks (April -Dec) and 2 weeks in January for Christmas trees.

Question 3:  Newspaper and Mixed Paper are combined together  Question 4:  Latex/Oil based Paint is collected on Wednesdays between April 1 and September 30 only (total of 26 days for 2010).  All others are collected on all operating days during the year (total 142 days for 2010).
Tonnage figures do not include municipal or school buildings.  those containers are not weighed.  We collect 4,386 yards of trash and 999 yards of recycling from those buildings.
Our facility bales mixed paper & ships to North Shore Recycled fibers  Yard waste collected is grass clippings & leaves only no brush, Christmas trees are collected and chipped

61 tons CRTs; 380# mercury/lithium/NiCd batteries; 15,301 linear feet fluorescent bulbs; 822 CFL's; 427# ballasts; 160 propane tanks; 28 tons tires; 49 tons mattresses/boxsprings; 173 tons clean wood; 1556 tons yard & leaf wastes; 320 tons wood chips.

Towns of Wellfleet, Truro and Provincetown has hazardous waste in each town that any of the three towns can go.  1-day Wellfleet (Aug)  1-day Truro (Sept) and 1-day Provincetown (Oct)   We are also building a new hopper next to our existing one that will be used for single stream, except cardboard.  We are also adding 22 large recycling bins to the busiest areas of town to try to capture the public recyclables.  We will add another 22 in July.
Member of South Shore Recycling Cooperative
Compost not included in recycling figures.

We have roll-off containers available to all (condo's, businesses, residents) at our drop-off site which was open 38 Saturdays last year and I do not believe that tonnage is tracked.  We also have scrap metal collectors that drive our routes and pick-up at our DPW on a 52 regular basis.  Saugus has many clothing collection boxes at Churches, YMCA, store parking lots, etc. that I do not receive tonnage info, as well as two Got Books collection boxes at Churches.  Library also runs book swaps throughout the year.  We also have  shredding  toters located in some Municipal buildings and I have not received that tonnage.
Member NBSWMD

The Town belongs to the Southern Berkshire Regional Household Hazardous Waste Collection Program. Seven mini site collections and two comprehensive collections were held in 2010.  The Town held 2 bulky waste days.

Wachusett Watershed Regional Recycling Center will collect all mercury, paint and other hazardous waste items now and in the future.  They are planning on at least 6 hazardous waste collection days per year starting 2011.

The Stockbridge participated in a Recycling Pilot Program put on by the state in June and July which combined paper and plastic for single sort recycling.  These two months were added into the survey under comingled containers since we could not specify how much was paper and how much was plastic.
no alkaline batteries accepted.   small amount of business trash is collected curbside (approx. 15 businesses)
We do not have numbers for specific recycling.  We only track the paper, co-mingle and trash tonnage.
The Uxbridge directs residents to the Blackstone Valley Recycling Center, Chestnut St, Blackstone, MA which will take items at a reduced fee.
Curbside collection of yard waste was three days per year one in the spring and two in the fall.    Used oil collection - Reading, DPW Yard, 75 New Crossing Road, Reading, MA

Wareham has only drop off municipal programs for residents,both solid waste and recycling.  Most residents contract indivdually or through their landlords for these services.  Businesses contract individually as well .  Municipal buildings and schools use a private hauler for both , which is a municipal program.
In Disposal Tonnage -- other materials consist of batteries, tires, and electronics.
77 tons of e-waste  3,140 tons compost  193 tons bulk

In the "other materials" category we itemize as follows: 49.96 tons of e-waste, 10.01 tons of tires, 18.22 tons of freon-bearing appliances and 0.25 tons of electric ballasts for a total of 78.44 tons.    Our recycling tonnages are itemized as follows: Our own municipal program- 1,635.18 tons paper/cardboard and 675.22 tons commingled (these are numbers from DEP and the Springfield MRF). In addition we have the totals from three private haulers serving our multifamilies, which are 90.22 tons commingled containers, 191.39 tons mixed paper and 195.56 tons cardboard for a grand total of 2022.13 tons paper and 765.44 tons commingled. This does not include 102.76 tons of single-stream recycling (which is shown above) from one of the private haulers serving the multifamilies.
Westhampton is part of the Hilltown Resource Management Cooperative
Cardboard is included with mixed paper.  Steel, tin cans, aluminum included with scrap metal.  Other materials - Clean wood, electronics, appliances w/freon, deposit containers.
Dried latex and oil based paint are thrown in the trash.
